grammars

Class Grammar

    BoolGrammar, MathGrammar, RayGrammar, StringGrammar, VarGrammar

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.CharSequence toCheck)
        Validates the given expression under this grammar. As soon as ANY rule fully validates toCheck, we return true.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The expression to validate.
        Returns:
        true if the given sequence is valid under the specific Grammar this method was called under, false otherwise. This method is very likely to cause exceptions to be thrown if the expressions contains variables that are being misused or do not exist.

      • validateNoThrow

        public boolean validateNoThrow(java.lang.CharSequence toCheck)
        Does the same work as validate, but will not throw any TypeErrors. VariableErrors will still be thrown if an unknown variable is used and VarRule has a non-null ScopeStack.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The expression to validate.
        Returns:
        true if the given sequence is valid under the specific Grammar this method was called under, false otherwise

      • exposeEntrypoint

        public java.util.List<Rule> exposeEntrypoint()
        Exposes the top level list of rules which other grammars can "plug into" if they depend on it. For example, the boolean grammar depends on the math grammar for parsing arbitrary integer expression in comparisons, so it uses this method.
        Returns:
        The top level list of rules. I.E, for the math grammar, it would be the level that includes the addition and subtraction rules. From this level, you can reach the entire rest of the grammar.

      • populateBinaryRules

        protected void populateBinaryRules(java.util.List<Rule> left,
                                   java.util.List<Rule> right,
                                   Rule... rules)
        Convenience method for populating the children of binary rules such as +,-,*, etc.
        Parameters:
        left - List of rules that should be the children of the left side of the expression
        right - List of rules that should be the children of the right side of the expression
        rules - The binary rules to add these children to.

      • keywordsToJava

        public java.lang.String keywordsToJava(java.lang.CharSequence toReplace)
        Entrypoint for converting Judo's special keywords like and, or, T, F, mod into their java equivalents. It is expected that the expressions passed to this function have already bee validated.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - The expression to do replacements within
        Returns:
        The same expression semantically, but with Judo keywords intelligently substituted for their Java equivalents. null if the expression isn't actually valid, probably.
